title: Blended Mathematics Education Program for Developing Clinical Problem-solving Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Mathematics Concepts and Practical Work Experience
context.additional_context: A course for enhancing math-based clinical problem-solving competencies among current practitioners, focusing on analyzing real-world cases and applying mathematical approaches

learning_goals: Learners can analyze clinical problems occurring in real work environments with over 80% accuracy through mathematical modeling.
Learners can select the optimal mathematical approach with over 90% accuracy based on data collected during problem-solving processes.
Learners can design mathematical solutions for complex clinical problems through team-based projects and successfully present them in at least two out of three attempts.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
